DOC.brief_summary: The present study was conducted among a group of Iranian patients suffering from varus knee in order to compare advantages and disadvantages of ROWHTO (Retro-Tubercle Opening Wedge High Tibial Osteotomy) technique when compared with previously described approaches of opening-wedge osteotomy.
DOC.brief_title: A Modified (Retro-Tubercle) Opening Wedge High Tibial Osteotomy Versus the Conventional Technique
DOC.detailed_description: There are various methods for correcting varus deformity; therefore the best surgical method must be individualized. We concluded that in a varus knee where only correction in the coronal plane without patella infra, changes in Q- angle, tibial plateau inclination is all that is needed, a retro- tubercle medial opening- wedge osteotomy is the preferred approach.
DOC.criteria: symptomatic varus deformity of the knee with 2 or more degrees of anatomical axis varus without ligament injury fractures through compartments of the knee or the patella osteoarthritis other than in the medial compartment 10 degrees or more extension lag tibial malrotation
